item.title: Rural Villa in Ferpicloz
item.description: Province Germania Superior Location Ferpicloz Ferpicloz (Pleiades) Garden Rural Villa in Ferpicloz Keywords archaeological garden \ porticoes villae rusticae Garden Description The house of this villa rustica was of the winged corridor type (A in Fig. 1) with a porticoed facade (Fig. 1). Attached to the eastern end of the house, measuring 37 x 46 meters, was a wall running east-west which has been interpreted as the protective wall of a garden (G in Fig. 1). Plans Fig. 1: Plan of the rural villa (A) with a possible garden (G) protected by a wall to the east of the main building. The shoreline of the lake is dotted. Adapted from Drack and Fellmann 1988, fig. 369. (Rights Statement) Dates unspecified Bibliography W. Drack and R. Fellmann, Die Römer in der Schweiz, Stuttgart, 1988, pp. 394-395, fig. 369.
